channel.title: How to add color to yell?
channel.description: Hello. I'm using a DeltaScape source, and a Dragon-History client. But when I write "::yell @blu@ Hello.", it just appears as "@blu@ Hello.". BUT, I've just tried to use it through Dark-Under-World client, and there it works perfectly, "@blu@" changes the color to blue. So does anyone know what I should add, in my client, to make it work?

item.title: How to add color to yell?
item.dc:creator: @badger41 badger41
item.description:
@badger41 wrote:

theres a tut on adding color commands to sendmessage (or yell) text, look on rune server

Read full topic

item.title: How to add color to yell?
item.dc:creator: @Mowiez Mowiez
item.description:
@Mowiez wrote:

You can also use "@red@ (Red), @bla@ (Black), @cya@ (Cyan Blue), @gre@ (Green) and more.

Read full topic

item.title: How to add color to yell?
item.dc:creator: @Owned_Pl0xs Owned_Pl0xs
item.description:
@Owned_Pl0xs wrote:

That will have to be sorted out in the TextDrawingArea class. If you’re using a non-renamed client, I don’t know the class name for the TextDrawingArea class, but that’s what will have to be modified to make @blu@ work.

Read full topic
item.source: How to add color to yell?

item.title: How to add color to yell?
item.dc:creator: @Southbird Southbird
item.description:
@Southbird wrote:

Hello.
I’m using a DeltaScape source, and a Dragon-History client. But when I write “::yell @blu@ Hello.”, it just appears as “@blu@ Hello.”.
BUT, I’ve just tried to use it through Dark-Under-World client, and there it works perfectly, “@blu@” changes the color to blue.
So does anyone know what I should add, in my client, to make it work?

Read full topic
